metadata.title: The Effects of Worker Displacement During the Industrial Revolution: Evidence from Sweden

relevance.topic: Worker displacement during the Industrial Revolution
relevance.relevance: The study is highly relevant as it provides quantitative evidence on the effects of worker displacement during the second industrial revolution, focusing on the Swedish iron industry.

design.sample_characteristics: Male workers aged 18-59 in the Swedish iron industry, observed in the 1880 and 1890 censuses.

dependent_variables.displaced: Ironworkers displaced by site closures between 1880 and 1890.
dependent_variables.unemployment_or_underemployment: Displaced workers were more likely to exit the iron industry and migrate.
dependent_variables.duration: Effects observed in 1890 and persisted in 1900.
dependent_variables.wage_changes: Displaced workers ended up in occupations that paid on average 10% less.

historical_context.economic_conditions: Period of rapid industrialization in Sweden's economic history.
historical_context.institutional_context: Liberal economic policies eroded pre-industrial institutions, facilitating industrial growth.

outcomes.main_findings: Displaced ironworkers were more likely to exit the industry, migrate, and end up in lower-paid occupations. Migration mitigated long-term negative effects for some workers.
outcomes.conclusions: Industrialization had long-lasting negative effects on displaced workers but did not significantly affect their children's earnings.
outcomes.long_term_impacts: Displacement did not have significant scarring effects on the next generation.

quality_assessment.methodological_limitations: Potential biases due to unobservable factors affecting both treatment and control groups.
quality_assessment.coherence: The data consistently supports the conclusions about displacement effects.
quality_assessment.adequacy_of_data: Rich data from archival sources and linked census data provide a robust basis for conclusions.
quality_assessment.relevance: The study is highly relevant to understanding historical labor displacement due to technological change.
